com.hitlabnz.outdoorar.api
Class OAARVRViewComponent

java.lang.Object
  android.view.View
      android.view.SurfaceView
          android.opengl.GLSurfaceView
              com.hitlabnz.androidar.viewcomponents.surface.ARSurface
                  com.hitlabnz.outdoorar.api.OAARVRViewComponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.SurfaceHolder.Callback, com.hitlabnz.androidar.viewcomponents.ARViewComponent.FovListener
public class OAARVRViewComponent
extends com.hitlabnz.androidar.viewcomponents.surface.ARSurface
implements com.hitlabnz.androidar.viewcomponents.ARViewComponent.FovListener

View for 3D scene visualization This class gives you access to controls for the 3D scene view.

Author:
Leigh Beattie

Constructor Detail

OAARVRViewComponent

public OAARVRViewComponent(android.content.Context context,
                           OADataManager dataManager,
                           OASensorManager sensorManager)
Construct a World View. Sets up data sources, OpenGL render surface and sensor reactions

Parameters:
context - The context to use for the renderer. Usually that is the activity that launches the renderer.
dataManager - The data manager to use
sensorManager - The sensor manager for getting location and orientation

setGridVisible

public void setGridVisible(boolean visible)
Set the visibility of the grid in the AR view.

Parameters:
visible - Set to true to have the grid visible and false if you don't want to see the grid.

addGLHelperComponent

Adds a GL Helper component to the scene graph

Parameters:
helperComponent -

enableOverviewMode

@Deprecated
public void enableOverviewMode()
Deprecated. 

Enable the overview mode for the AR view. This will change the camera so that it centers it's view on the currently selected point of interest and the accelerometers/gyroscope and GPS control the camera's position around the point of interest.

enableARMode

@Deprecated
public void enableARMode()
Deprecated. 

Enable the AR mode. This will change the camera so it is positioned at the user's GPS coordinates and uses the devices orientation to change the camera's point of view. This view mode will use the camera as the background image for the 3D scene.

setDistanceFadeToIcon

@Deprecated
public void setDistanceFadeToIcon(int distance)
Deprecated. 

setDataManager

public void setDataManager(OADataManager dataManager)
Assign a data manager to the World view. The datamanager is used to tell the world view where to fetch data from.

Parameters:
dataManager - The DataManger related to your project.

setClearColour

public void setClearColour(float r,
                           float g,
                           float b,
                           float a)
Set clear (background) colour of the GL scene

Parameters:
r - red component of the colour (0.0 - 1.0)
g - green component of the colour (0.0 - 1.0)
b - blue component of the colour (0.0 - 1.0)
a - alpha component of the colour (0.0 - 1.0)

useFovAspectRatio

public void useFovAspectRatio(boolean enable)
Whether to use fov information to calculate aspect ratio. This helps better registration in AR, although the aspect ratio could appear not natural.

Parameters:
enabled -

enableCameraOrientationTracking

public void enableCameraOrientationTracking(boolean enable)
Whether to user tracking sensor information to update the camera orientation. This is enabled by default for the AR view. Disable it for VR mode.

Parameters:
enable -
